sections.markdown:
## Metrics on Grail
* Las métricas de Grail le permiten identificar y recuperar cualquier dato de métrica con la ayuda de DQL.
* ¡Las métricas pueden generar tendencias, analizarse e incluso pronosticarse con Davis AI!
* [Ejemplo Metrics en Grail](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/metrics-on-grail-examples)
* [Lista de  Meticas en Grail](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/built-in-metrics-on-grail) o selecciona SUPPORTED IN GRAIL en la pantalla de metricas
![](https://github.com/JasonOstroski/perform-hot24-intro-to-dql/blob/main/images/metricsongrail.jpg?raw=true)

# Ejercicio 1
1. Obtener la métrica de la serie temporal de carga de CPU por host

sections.title: Ejercicio 1.1 - Obten la metrica CPU load en una grafica sobre el tiempo por host

metrics.description: The average number of processes that are being executed by CPU or waiting to be executed by CPU over the last minute

sections.markdown:
# Ejercicio 2
1. Encuentre la serie temporal promedio para el "uso de CPU del proceso"
2. Filtrar por grupo de procesos de entidad y host de entidad
3. Utilice el pronóstico de Davis para predecir la tendencia en el tiempo.
4. Extraiga datos del explorador de datos y utilícelos en DQL
5. Agregue la etiqueta "PRUEBA" en el filtro seguida del tipo de host

sections.title: Ejercicio 2.1 - Encuentre la serie temporal promedio para el "uso de CPU del proceso"

metrics.description: This metric provides the percentage of the CPU usage of a process. The metric value is the sum of CPU time every process worker uses divided by the total available CPU time. The result is expressed in percentage. A value of 100% indicates that the process uses all available CPU resources of the host. It has a "Process" dimension (dt.entity.process_group_instance).

sections.title: Ejercicio 2.2 - Filtrar por grupo de procesos de entidad y host de entidad

grail.canonicalQuery:
timeseries by:{dt.entity.host, dt.entity.process_group}, avg(dt.process.cpu.usage)
| filter dt.entity.host == "HOST-84D65AF93A3C185A"
| filter dt.entity.process_group == "PROCESS_GROUP-61146D5E680336D1"

metrics.description: This metric provides the percentage of the CPU usage of a process. The metric value is the sum of CPU time every process worker uses divided by the total available CPU time. The result is expressed in percentage. A value of 100% indicates that the process uses all available CPU resources of the host. It has a "Process" dimension (dt.entity.process_group_instance).

sections.title: Ejercicio 2.3 - Utilice el pronóstico de Davis para predecir la tendencia en el tiempo.

metrics.description: This metric provides the percentage of the CPU usage of a process. The metric value is the sum of CPU time every process worker uses divided by the total available CPU time. The result is expressed in percentage. A value of 100% indicates that the process uses all available CPU resources of the host. It has a "Process" dimension (dt.entity.process_group_instance).

This metric provides the percentage of the CPU usage of a process. The metric value is the sum of CPU time every process worker uses divided by the total available CPU time. The result is expressed in percentage. A value of 100% indicates that the process uses all available CPU resources of the host. It has a "Process" dimension (dt.entity.process_group_instance).

grail.canonicalQuery:
timeseries by:{dt.entity.host, dt.entity.process_group}, avg(dt.process.cpu.usage)
| filter dt.entity.process_group == "PROCESS_GROUP-B38B51D78E9FDAD7"
| filter dt.entity.host == "HOST-CCD870C19C09862F"

metrics.description: This metric provides the percentage of the CPU usage of a process. The metric value is the sum of CPU time every process worker uses divided by the total available CPU time. The result is expressed in percentage. A value of 100% indicates that the process uses all available CPU resources of the host. It has a "Process" dimension (dt.entity.process_group_instance).

sections.markdown:
## Ejercicio 2.4
* Ve al data explorer y pega la expresion siguiente en el modo avanzado
```builtin:host.cpu.usage:avg:splitBy("dt.entity.host"):filter(and(in("dt.entity.host",entitySelector("type(host)"))))```
* Abra un notebook y pege el DQL para observar la metrica
![](https://github.com/JasonOstroski/perform-hot24-intro-to-dql/blob/main/images/dataexplorer.jpg?raw=true)

sections.title: Ejercicio 2.4 - Extraiga datos del explorador de datos y utilícelos en DQL

metrics.description: Percentage of CPU time when CPU was utilized. A value close to 100% means most host processing resources are in use, and host CPUs can’t handle additional work

sections.markdown:
# Ejercicio 3
1. ¡Explore las métricas en el mosaico Notebook! (Actualmente es una característica en fase beta, ¡más opciones por venir!)

metrics.description: Percentage of time when CPU was idle during which the system had an outstanding I/O request. It is not available on Windows.
